ayas.translation: THE CONCRETE REALITY.
What is the concrete reality?
What do you comprehend by the concrete reality?
The Thamud and 'Ad denied the consequential calamity.
So destroyed were the Thamud by a storm of thunder and lightning;

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
ayas.translation: And the 'Ad were destroyed by the furious cold blast of roaring wind

ayas.arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَـٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
ayas.translation: Which He sent to assail them for seven nights and eight days running. You should have seen the people prostrate like the decayed trunks of date-palm trees.
ayas.transliteration: sakhharahā `alayhim sab`a layālin wathamāniyata ayyāmin ḥusūman fataral qawma fīhā ṣar`ā ka-annahum a`jāzu nakhlin khāwiyah

ayas.translation: Do you see any trace of them?

ayas.arabic: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
ayas.translation: Then came the Pharaoh, and those before him whose habitations were overthrown while they were committing crimes.
ayas.transliteration: wajā-a fir`awnu wa man qablahu wal mu-tafikātu bil khāṭi-ah

ayas.arabic: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
ayas.translation: When they disobeyed the apostle of their Lord He seized them with an overwhelming punishment.
ayas.transliteration: fa`aṣaw rasūla rabbihim fa-akhadhahum akhdhatan rābiyah

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَـٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ
ayas.translation: When the water rose in flood, We bore you in the ark,
ayas.transliteration: innā lammā ṭaghal mā-u ḥamalnākum fil jāriyah

ayas.arabic: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌ وَٰعِيَةٌ
ayas.translation: In order to make it a warning for you, and that the ear retentive may preserve it.
ayas.transliteration: linaj`alahā lakum tadhkiratan wata`iyahā udhunun wā`iyah

ayas.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ
ayas.translation: When the single blast is sounded on the trumpet,
ayas.transliteration: fa-idhā nufikha fiṣ ṣūri nafkhatun wāḥidah

ayas.arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَٰحِدَةً
ayas.translation: And the earth and mountains heaved and crushed to powder with one levelling blow,
ayas.transliteration: waḥumilatil-arḍu wal jibālu fadukkatā dakkatan wāḥidah

ayas.translation: On that Day will come what is to come.
The sky will cleave asunder on that day and fall to pieces.

ayas.arabic: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَـٰنِيَةٌ
ayas.translation: On its fringes will be angels, eight of them, bearing their Lord's throne aloft.
ayas.transliteration: wal malaku `alā arjā-ihā ۚ wayaḥmilu `arsha rabbika fawqahum yawma-idhin thamāniyah

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
ayas.translation: You will then be set before Him, and not one of you will remain unexposed.
ayas.transliteration: yawma-idhin tu`raḍūna lā takhfā minkum khāfiyah

ayas.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
ayas.translation: He who is given his ledger in his right hand, will say: "Here, read my ledger.
ayas.transliteration: fa-ammā man ūtiya kitābahu biyamīnihi fayaqūlu hā-umuq-ra-ū kitābiyah

ayas.translation: I was certain I'll be given my account."
So he shall have an agreeable life
In high empyrean
With fruits hanging low within reach,

ayas.arabic: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ
ayas.translation: (And told:) "Eat and drink to your fill as reward for (good) deeds you had done in days of yore."
ayas.transliteration: kulū washrabū hanī-an bimā aslaftum fil-ayyāmil khāliyah

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
ayas.translation: But whosoever gets his ledger in his left hand, will say: "Would that I were never given my ledger,
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammā man ūtiya kitābahu bishimālihi fayaqūlu yālaytanī lam ūta kitābiyah

ayas.translation: And not known my account!
I wish death had put an end to me.
Of no use was even my wealth.
Vanished has my power from me."
"Seize him and manacle him,
Then cast him to be burnt in Hell;

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ
ayas.translation: And string him to a chain seventy cubits long.
ayas.transliteration: thumma fī silsilatin dhar`uhā sab`ūna dhirā`an faslukūh

ayas.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayas.translation: He did not believe in God the supreme,
Nor urged others to feed the poor.
That is why he has no friend today,
Nor food other than suppuration (filth)
Which none but the hellish eat."
So, I call to witness what you see
And what you do not see,
That this is indeed the word of the noble Messenger,

ayas.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
ayas.translation: And not the word of a poet. How little is it that you believe!
ayas.transliteration: wa mā huwa biqawli shā`ir ۚ qalīlan mā tu-minūn

ayas.arabic: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
ayas.translation: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer. Little is it that you reflect!
ayas.transliteration: walā biqawli kāhin ۚ qalīlan mā tadhakkarūn

ayas.translation: It has been sent down by the Lord of all the worlds.
Had he attributed falsely any words to Us,
We would have seized him by his right hand,
Then cut off his aorta,

ayas.arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَـٰجِزِينَ
ayas.translation: And not one of you would have been able to stop (Us).
It is really a reminder for those who fear God and follow the straight path.
We certainly know that some among you do deny it.
ayas.transliteration: wa innā lana`lamu anna minkum mukadhhibīn

ayas.translation: It is surely the nemesis of unbelievers.
And He, He is indeed the ultimate Reality.
So glorify your Lord, the most supreme.
